intro: Crepis kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish mouse-ear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia, including parts of Turkey, Iran, and Afghanistan. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Crepis kurdica is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cooler, well-drained conditions.
